00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 #include "ht32_board_config.h"
00032 
00033 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00034   * @{
00035   */
00036 
00037 /** @addtogroup WDT_Examples WDT
00038   * @{
00039   */
00040 
00041 /** @addtogroup Auto_Enable
00042   * @{
00043   */
00044 
00045 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 ErrStatus AutoWDT_Cmd(ControlStatus autoWdtCmd);
00047 
00048 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00049 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00050   * @brief  Main program.
00051   * @retval None
00052   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00053 int main(void)
00054 {
00055   /* Enable WDT APB clock                                                                                   */
00056   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00057   CKCUClock.Bit.WDT = 1;
00058   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00059 
00060   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00061   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00062   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED2);
00063 
00064   if(RSTCU_GetResetFlagStatus(RSTCU_FLAG_WDTRST) == SET)
00065   {
00066     /* WDT generates a reset request and then turns on LED2.                                                */
00067     HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED2);
00068   }
00069   else
00070   {
00071     /* Other functions generate a reset request and then turns on LED1.                                     */
00072     HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1);
00073   }
00074   RSTCU_ClearAllResetFlag();          /* Clear reset flag                                                   */
00075 
00076   /* Enable the Auto_WDT                                                                                    */
00077   if(AutoWDT_Cmd(ENABLE) == ERROR)
00078   {
00079     /* Fail, Turn off LED1 and LED2.                                                                        */
00080     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED1);
00081     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED2);
00082   }
00083 
00084   while (1)
00085   {
00086     WDT_Restart();          /* Reload Counter as WDTV Value                                                 */
00087   }
00088 }
00089 
00090 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00091  * @brief Enable or Disable the Auto_WDT by programming FLASH OB page.
00092  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00093  * @retval SUCCESS or ERROR
00094  ************************************************************************************************************/
00095 ErrStatus AutoWDT_Cmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00096 {
00097   FLASH_OptionByte ObStatus;
00098   FLASH_State flashStatus;
00099   ErrStatus result = SUCCESS;
00100 
00101   /* Get Option Byte status                                                                                 */
00102   FLASH_GetOptionByteStatus(&ObStatus);
00103   if(ObStatus.OptionProtect||ObStatus.MainSecurity)
00104   {
00105     /* Security or Option Protection is enabled. Can not modify Option.                                     */
00106     result = ERROR;
00107   }
00108   else if(NewState == ENABLE)
00109   {
00110     /* Enable Auto WDT.                                                                                     */
00111     if(rw(HTCFG_OB_WDT_ADDR) != HTCFG_OB_WDT_START_CODE)
00112     {
00113       /* Before enable Auto WDT, the erase operation should be performed                                    */
00114       flashStatus = FLASH_EraseOptionByte();
00115       /* Enable Auto WDT.                                                                                   */
00116       flashStatus |= FLASH_ProgramWordData(HTCFG_OB_WDT_ADDR, HTCFG_OB_WDT_START_CODE);
00117       if(flashStatus == FLASH_COMPLETE)
00118       {
00119         /* Successful operation and reset the system                                                        */
00120         NVIC_SystemReset();
00121       }
00122       else
00123       {
00124         result = ERROR;          /* Fail operation.                                                         */
00125       }
00126     }
00127   }
00128   else
00129   {
00130     /* Diable Auto WDT.                                                                                     */
00131     if(rw(HTCFG_OB_WDT_ADDR) == HTCFG_OB_WDT_START_CODE)
00132     {
00133       /* Disabl Auto WDT by erasing option byte.                                                            */
00134       flashStatus = FLASH_EraseOptionByte();
00135       if(flashStatus == FLASH_COMPLETE)
00136       {
00137         /* Successful operation and reset the system                                                        */
00138         NVIC_SystemReset();
00139       }
00140       else
00141       {
00142         result = ERROR;          /* Fail operation.                                                         */
00143       }
00144     }
00145   }
00146 
00147   return result;
00148 }

00157 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)

00159   /*
00160      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00161      Debug message can be added here.
00162      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00163   */
00164 
00165   while (1)
00166   {
00167   }
00168 }
